Amy Schumer: 'Meat pies make me crazy' Star of Trainwreck Amy Schumer delves into finding her voice, fearlessness, the hypocrisies of the being a 'female' comedian in today's society and of course, meat pies.
PT5M38S http://www.canberratimes.com.au/action/externalEmbeddedPlayer?id=d-3zlab 620 349 July 20, 2015 Autoplay On Off Video feedback Video settings Amy Schumer's book deal Amy Schumer's work ethic   Full movies coverage Movie session times Amy Schumer is reportedly being paid 10 times more for her next movie than for her first feature  Trainwreck .
That film grossed $138.3 million ($A190 million) worldwide but Schumer, who starred in the movie and wrote the screenplay, earned only $300,000 ($A416,000).
Bill Hader and Amy Schumer on the set of Trainwreck . Photo: Bobby Bank 
The new feature project, which she is executive producing with her sister Kim Caramele, will net Schumer up to $5 million ($A6.9 million), a pay rise of more than 1000 per cent, says The Hollywood Reporte r.
Advertisement The star, whose career is on a meteoric rise, reportedly initially asked for $10 million ($A13.8 million) for the untitled mother/daughter comedy, which is being directed by Jonathan Levine ( Warm Bodies ) and set for a May 2017 release.
It is based on a screenplay by Katie Dippold, who wrote the female buddy film  The Heat and the upcoming all-female  Ghostbusters  reboot.
Schumer has only recently started earning a Hollywood-level salary despite wining an Emmy for her TV series Inside Amy Schumer , hosting Saturday Night Live , and scoring a book deal worth up to $10 million ($A13.8 million). The book, a memoir pitched under the title  The Girl With the Lower Back Tattoo , will be released in late 2016.
Wage equality in Hollywood has been a hot topic of late with Jennifer Lawrence writing an essay about the movie industry's gender-based pay gap for Lena Dunham's Lenny newsletter.
"I'm over trying to find the "adorable" way to state my opinion and still be likable!" she wrote. "F*** that. I don't think I've ever worked for a man in charge who spent time contemplating what angle he should use to have his voice heard. It's just heard."
Schumer is also writing a comedy screenplay with Lawrence in which the pair play sisters. Schumer and Lawrence became friends this year, with Schumer sharing photos of the pair holidaying in the Hamptons.
